NK cells are among the first population of cells to recuperate following transplantation and play an important role as first-line response against viral infections.
16 First NK subset to recover express CD56 brightCD16âˆ’ and are derived from hematopoietic CD34+ cells, which give rise to CD56 dimCD16+, which have cytotoxic capabilities. These are found mostly in peripheral blood.
17 Furthermore, NK cell transfusions following HSCT have been shown in some groups to reduce the relapse of acute myeloid leukemia, decrease GVHD, and improve engraftment and the overall survival.
